bow: counseling services prior to pregnancy help am deathly afraid of giving birth will make this brief but basically am deathly afraid of giving birth am also kindergarten teacher with strong maternal instincts and desire to be mother have been with my now husband since high school and we want family but my fear is so intense that avoid pregnancy like the plague my fear of birth has been since childhood remember crying and hiding my face during birth scenes of movies have no idea where my fear came from but any time the topic is brought up get tense and my heart starts pounding specifically am absolutely terrified of anything being done to me against my will fundal massages episiotomies etc feel almost rather die than have section and be awake during abdominal surgery also petrified of failing epidural please do not dismiss my fears as ridiculous know to many of you they are but can not help my emotions in my own you mothers are absolute superheroes to me who have lived and overcome my worst nightmares hope to be as strong as all of you one day have considered adoption but would love to overcome my fears so my question is is anyone aware of counseling services for someone in my situation would it be appropriate to seek help before getting pregnant this sounds like major anxiety issue or phobia and really do think you should seek therapy someone trained in anxiety disorders and cbt may be really helpful don think you need motherhood specific therapist just like someone afraid of flying doesn need an airplane specific therapist yes meet with psychologist there are variety of techniques that can be utilized to help clinical hypnosis may also be worth considering check credentials you dont want some lay person offering hypnosis thank you didn consider going to regular therapist guess fear judgement from them and the ob eventually choose it is so frustrating just wish was normal will do some research thanks have fear of pain avoid doing my eyebrows until the situation is so bad ca do it in one session but ll look ridiculous if leave it half done was so afraid of giving birth ended up balling my eyes out several times never had fear of birth as pronounced as yours just general fear of pain but here is how it went down my birthing experience is blur but can tell you was flinching so much when they put my epidural that the doctor told me stand still or you re doing it without it knowing that my water broke but the contractions were not growing closer or regular and we had to induce them was keen on it took deep breath gathered my thoughts and focused on what was important and not my fears in way shoved them in corner of my mind it all went well in the end was bottling up my fears and anxiety like that healthy ca say but probably not would have benefited from visit with specialist regarding my fear of birth certainly go you would benefit from it oh yes absolutely seek counseling there are things you can do to improve or or eliminate your fears even if you do choose to adopt it no fun running around with terrorizing fears that can jump out at you any moment was afraid too made decision for the sake of my sanity and vagina and went with caesarean would make the same choice all over again it is so amazing how you were able to overcome your fear and just focus on your baby think it was unacceptable how your doctor spoke to you and hope have someone more compassionate that is one of the things am most afraid of sometimes doctors need to be firm for the safety of their patients scared of things being done to me too can stand the thought of section or even an episiotomy either so hire midwives for homebirth no drugs unfortunately but heh no cuts either where live in california they can do episiotomies but the ones ve asked have never performed one never needed to it went well for me with baby and hiring them again for baby on the way it cuts waaaay down on the fears for me at least absolutely agree with the others about finding therapist and will also say get as many recommendations as you can for an ob who is compassionate many are but some do not have the best bedside manner and you definitely want to find someone who is sensitive to your needs and will respect your wishes think this fear is too uncommon and you should be able to find good therapist and ob who will help you through it agree with the other commenter about doctors needing to be firm with patients sometimes may need to point out that had great time at the hospital the people were amazing compassionate and caring if bit tough in expressing it certainly had better time than many of my friends who gave birth never saw it that way but it comes down to expectations live in post soviet democracy where doctors have grimy dark sense of humour and nurses are harsh and unhelpful went to private hospital to give birth expected bit more control of what is happening than in state run one and got more than expected actually what this doctor did was what needed to get my head back in the game and concentrate on what was important do forget that the risks of flinching while they put in the epidural are far great and not to be underestimated but the psychological effects of traumatic birth experience can be worse he had much more to think about than just how he sounded in the moment also suffered from tokophobia and found that knowledge was power as was prozac for my depression anxiety about it attend al the classes hospital and local buy books science ones and hippie ones mom groups preggo friends new mama friends and family support learning my body was meant for this and surrendering with little pill confidence did the trick now have three month old angel and am kinda already ready to do it again heh think therapist who specializes in treating anxiety is the way to go and you are normal for someone with anxiety and anxiety disorders are actually really common am sure my fear does compare to yours but was very afraid to give birth once became pregnant took birthing classes at my hospital really just did it because my ob suggested it but after learning all about the process of giving birth and the different options available felt so much better know for me just having knowledge of what would be going on and different strategies for how to deal with the pain made huge difference obviously it would be kind of strange to go to birthing class as someone who not pregnant but learning about it might help and sure hospital would welcome you to take class there are also lot of videos on youtube that are informative and not just gory images of giving birth tv and movies make giving birth seem like the worst thing in the world was pleasantly surprised yes there was pain but nothing compared to what had feared have had two kids and pregnant with the 3rd right now after each delivery felt like it was as big of deal as everyone make it out to be like the other commenters said definitely think therapy is good option because it sounds like you have very intense fear but learning more about the birthing process might help good luck was pretty scared with my first pregnancy not to the point that sought counseling but when it came time to push was so scared that starting shaking uncontrollably it was weird experience but got an epidural which worked fine and it was definitely much much less scary than had been imagining with the second child was super laid back and relaxed because knew what to expect for sure talking to therapist about this could be great help think imo it normal to be somewhat scared but not to the extent that it prevents you from living your life and having the family you want think counseling is great idea then when you re ready to get pregnant make sure you find the right ob and the right hospital to work with you to address your fears another option is to hire doula for the birth she will help you get through labor and will be an advocate for you with the medical staff understand your phobias had some too birth was very difficult experience but pregnant again so it goes to show that we can process the trauma go with an experienced and kind ob who may be willing to do caesarean under general think for your case avoid midwife just my two cents and have against midwives am using them this time around but they tend to prefer low intervention births and are all about it being an empowering experience whereas for many women it painful and hard and we want it to be over and that okay for my first was glad to be with an ob for some of the same factors as you re experiencing this time was ready to try something different do think counselling is an important step for you really wish you all the best and know you re not alone meeting with counselor or something will probably help but as someone who was also deathly terrified of giving birth ll tell ya this when you start into real labor all that fear sorta washes away and is replaced with very primal sort of this is happening and gon na do it feeling of determination at least that how it was for me agree that counseling could help you also had ton of anxiety about giving birth with my first child was terrified of getting section hate hospitals and had witnessed my sister very traumatic delivery of her first son 20+ hours of labor and then an emergency and an epidural that did work so she had to be put under general anesthesia anyway did lot of research and decided to hire birthing doula she was amazing and really set my mind at ease in the weeks leading up to the birth and when was in labor and delivering she was an advocate for me in the hospital and voiced my concerns and wishes to the staff of course the greatest help she offered was with pain management she was very skilled at trying new position or massaging me or getting my husband to massage me or talk to me in way that was soothing and comforting ca say enough how wonderful she was highly recommend having doula in the room when you give birth two books read and found helpful are misconceptions by naomi wolf and ina may guide to childbirth idk how much use they would be to you but both helped me immensely did not experience the orgasmic natural childbirth that ina may describes but it was interesting to see birth from different perspectives and got me thinking about pain management etc honey no one will dismiss your fears because to some degree we all have or had them agree with everyone else that you should seek therapy but also want to tell you what worked for me in addressing my fears and getting comfortable with the birth experience my husband was with me for labour and delivery so we did classes which helped his fear spoke to an obgyn about the process and found one was confident would respect and inform me if you don have an obgyn you could look into getting doula or private midwife to be your advocate met with midwife at the hospital and had birth plan that explained was sexual assaults survivor and approaching me from behind may give me panic attack this was explained to everyone who came into my birthing suite because the team was aware spent time reading other people birth stories wrote birth plan but also used meditation techniques to accept that would need to trust the process go with the flow this was easier because trusted my team during my birth experience very little went to plan ended up with an emergency sect after substantial amount of labour having said that felt respected cared for and most importantly informed the entire time hope you can find way to address your fears that works for you my ob has pregnancy safe medicine for anxiety and depression so you might want to try there first or you should ask them for therapist talking or psychiatrist medicine recommendation was terrified of my first pregnancy my mom was midwife and ve seen some ish was the exact same way could have written this post two years ago did go to counseling but started watching birth videos on instagram no one posts traumatic ones they re always positive and slowly over the course of my pregnancy the fear turned to excitement all these women ended up with beautiful babies all these women survived most of them did it without medicine some in their own homes would force myself to watch them but soon was saving them and watching them on loop it was kind of like desensitizing myself to it followed hundreds of women who were at the same stage of pregnancy as me and watched as we all got bigger nested worried then started having babies half my friends list has kid within month of my due date watched them go through it right there with me by the time got induced was terrified again suddenly could remember those women and all the fears of an emergency section or my body being destroyed crept back in and then somehow 22 hours later was holding my son did even tear thought could get through it and did gave birth to my perfect little baby imagine lot of us even the most confident start to panic once it go time it normal to have fears even if yours and mine are more anxiety than fear it normal to be scared and it normal to worry it wo go the way you want but you know what you get through it even if there speed bump or two along the way we get through it mother nature would have made us incapable of giving birth because then there would be anyone left child birth was really not that bad for me its almost like that motherly instinct takes over and all you care about is getting the baby out safely everything is blur and as soon as had the baby the pain went away got my epidural after my water broke and was only dialated to 3cm they refilled it several times before actually delivered because it was in for so long have regrets about that why be in pain when you dont have to be contractions were intense and uncomfortable but not painful if that makes sense the epidural took the edge off for sure once it came to the pushing part my body just took over couple times the nurses told me to stop pushing because the doctor was in the room yet but could stop my body kept pushing tore pretty badly but did feel it at all the epidural kept me from feeling the stitches going in too post child birth was given norco for the pain which did the trick but was really shocked how fast recovered hope my experience makes you more hopeful of an easy delivery honestly giving birth is such an unpredictable thing and totally get the anxiety behind it though but its completely worth it pregnancy and giving birth is the most amazing thing ever hope you are able to overcome your fear experience it some day agree with what everyone else said that you need to see therapist on top of that would recommend birth preparation program that focuses on fear clearing like hypnobabies would look into reading some ina may books she midwife who has been delivering babies since the 70s you do have to be into natural birth at all to benefit from her literature she is so empowering when the talks about how women give birth she has changed me entire outlook on how amazing our bodies are when we are pregnant and when in labor there is secret in our culture and it is not that birth is painful but that women are strong same midwives typically do injure you harm your body or meddle with labor and birth the way doctors do also if you are afraid of doctors giving you an episiotomy look into keeping any future sons of yours intact cutting newborn babies genitals is reccomended by any medical organization and it is very good way to be brought into this world removed anesthesiologists do tend to be compassionate and would expect to find one who is the good news is that you spend the least amount of time with them and you ll have midwife totally recommend midwife by the way or ob there with you and they can be very compassionate being afraid of birth is sane and something most women have been afraid of through history but there are ways of getting yourself through intact especially if you are proactive was scared but so many people dismissed my fear that when the time came to give birth was not prepared it was horrific have flashbacks to this day many women do get absolutely furious at all the women who think that because they were fine birth is fine for everyone it is and there is any way around it the hospital system will do things to you that you wo even know to refuse until it is too late midwives too are no guarantee ve heard stories that would make your blood curdle and that just from the births that went well but like many dangerous and painful ordeals there are things you can do get therapy to give you coping skills be in your best physical health to lessen the chance of complications and an age where you have the best chance of good outcome the older you get the harder it is look up your hospital not just your ob and have someone there who will advocate for you in the moment not your baby daddy no matter how great they are say to day they ll be under too much to be able to be there for you too trusted friend or doula someone who is there solely to advocate for you and most of all do not dismiss your own fears it not just moment that fades it turning point that makes your life forever different we pretend things are fine because society sells this narrative that birth is few moments of pain the truth is that recovery from the psychological torment takes long time and has to be done while you are weak as kitten bleeding more than you ve ever bled in your life and expected to do the majority of care for tiny creature without more than minutes of rest at time prepare in every way you can op it can be wonderful but it can also be miserable good luck didn know pregnant woman could take medication like that have never looked into it but will thank you you are an angel thank you had doula https en wikipedia org wiki doula and highly recommend having one to help guide you through the emotional parts of childbirth **doula** doula also known as birth companion birth coach or post birth supporter is non medical person who stays with and assists woman before during or after childbirth to provide emotional support and physical help if needed they also may provide support to the mother partner and family unlike midwife doulas are not classified as medical professionals and therefore can not administer medication doulas are typically certified with some courses taking over year to complete *** ^pm https www reddit com message compose to=kittens from was pregnant my first thought was not how happy was but omg have to birth oh no no no my whole pregnancy basically just tried not to think about it and focused on other things like my hair and how long it was getting lol the one thing will say not sure if it helps or not is that all that anxiety went away 100 when labor started my labor sucked and it hurt but it something my body knew how to do on reflex and my mind just didn have any room to be anxious anymore my body totally took over so was anxious while being pregnant but birthing there is just simply no room for it even if wanted there to be sorry if this makes no sense just positive story for you had fantastic experience birthing my 16 month old the epidural made it 100 pain free for me and it was so empowering was also terrified to give birth but honest to god would do it again with an epidural that is any day of the week also work in maternal mental health and this does sound like slight anxiety issue counseling could help tons oh my this is my dream birth story crossing all of my fingers and toes that this happens go into it with an open mind and go with the flow promise you it won be as bad as you re imagining modern medicine is beautiful thing the beginning part of this made me want my tubes tied ten minutes ago removed look into hiring birth doula as well she will help you stick to your birth plan and support you emotionally and physically throughout the process you are more likely to have the birth you want with doula to help empower you definitely get help with the anxiety but also round up your support team good non biased support team also get information directly from professionals and in person where you can the internet as much as love it can have some horrible stories and worse terrifying misinformation that could make your anxiety worse was afraid of birth don think had the intense phobia you seem to but definitely was afraid of something going wrong perhaps take doula training course or tour birth center with midwives do more to learn about what you fear but it sounds like ultimately you know you want to do this so you can be mother super worth it in my opinion it helped me reduce my anxiety to seek birth center birth was way more concerned and scared of interventions like you described above so sought an out of hospital birth to reduce my risk of having section as pregnancy progressed got less nervous about birth was more excited to have my baby in my arms it goes wrong for sure so does the flu my dad almost died of the flu once so does driving car people die in cars think therapy would help you put this fear in perspective was pretty terrified of it mostly the idea of section being awake is horrifying to me additionally the idea of an epidural is awful so the fear of an epidural is what pushed me to have natural birth and then was just lucky enough to not need section didn take any birthing classes because wanted to think about the birthing process as little as possible and just went with it guess don really have any advise because went through it with avoidance luck as my labor was relatively short also really liked watching the show call the midwife the birthing scenes were uncomfortable but realistic enough to get me used to the idea of labor though they aren huge focus of the show aren graphic check out the birth hour podcast each episode interviews different woman to describe her birth experience very informative interesting and educational have bipolar with anxiety issues stayed on my antidepressant and antipsychotic medication through my entire pregnancy and while breastfeeding with no ill effects check out www mothertobaby org for information on taking medication while pregnant you can even chat with an expert for free about different meds during pregnancy make sure you are educated on the risks of homebirth was theoretically perfect candidate for one but elected to labor in hospital my son was born with the cord tight around his neck and an apgar of if the nicu had been literally 10 second away he would have died they are also not trained to handle life threatening complications the way doctors are cried several times during pregnancy because was scared literally just did think about it knew it was going to happen regardless so just did not think about it actively avoided the topic even to myself was pretty successful then labor started for me it did seem like labor it just seemed like my period was about to start type crampiness and leaky vag drove myself to the hospital just because the leakiness was stopping and just wanted to be sure all was good hours later there was baby got super lucky but my pregnancy was god awful so deserved it but really it got uncomfortable but got an epidural before it because grit your teeth pain and felt nothing but pressure pregnancy and recovery were way worse for me everyone is different just kept thinking women would do it more than once if they could handle it in addition to counseling you might find ina may work helpful try spiritual midwifery and in may guide go childbirth they are cool books about hippie ladies in commune giving birth and loving it the births range from challenging to orgasmic seriously some women claim to have orgasmic births might not cure an ingrained phobia on its own but nice to have some positive narratives floating around in your mind along with the fearful ones good luck ps fwiw loved both of my childbirth experiences there was pain and they did get really intense but for me at least it was quite manageable with breathing visualization etc not that it that way for everyone but it not terrible for everyone either you will absolutely not be judged and you are not some kind of freak everyone has something that terrifies them was very afraid albeit not like you but honestly once you get to 39 weeks and you cant sleep or feel your feet you kind of begin to get over it because you re so ready to have the baby not saying that you shouldn seek therapy you should but you should also be aware that fear of labor is normal and it also normal for that fear to at least partially diminish the closer you get to it think therapist is great idea though was the same way have an anxiety disorder and also have heightened sensitivity to pain with certain things anything medically done that causes pressure not pain is excruciating during my first pregnancy was so scared especially towards the end remember frantically trying to figure out way not to give birth but quickly reminding myself that there is no way out baby will come eventually and she will be so worth it the first pregnancy they stopped all my anti anxiety meds by second one there was research showing my anti anxiety medication bupropion was safe during pregnancy so was allowed to stay on it which helped first pregnancy anything that could go wrong did go wrong gestational diabetes severe pre eclampsia urgent induction epidural that took anesthesiologists hours and tries to get in 24 hours of labor where failed to progress lost my epidural with pitocin at max ouch baby was hooked behind my pelvis and face up went to section went under general anesthesia since epidural had failed had reaction to the anesthesia then had hemorrhage and spent day in icu the reason told you all of that knowing that that is what you are scared off is because was terrified of all of those things happening too during my childbirth prep class they are showing normal healthy easy deliveries and was chugging water the whole time to try and focus on not crying in front of all the other expecting couples wanted to vomit the next day broke down and bawled to my coworkers because was so scared then all of the fears had about pain came true but here is the thing made it through with the support of my husband my mom and my ob and even though my coworkers all thought would never want another baby because all my fears came true had second baby years later and the second delivery was dream spinal anesthesia literally felt nothing during the second section not even the pressure they told me they couldn get rid of it was so easy literally thought man could do this again in the middle of the section the first birth was rough 24 hours but almost years later have my absolutely amazing daughter to look at and would do it all over in heartbeat all of my complications were just culmination of bad luck and unlikely to happen to you but it could you know that but it will be worth it you could also be like my best first who had contractions for hours active later for hour and pushed twice easy as can be my advice is hope for the best anything could happen focus on your end goal this might sound weird but would carry newborn pampers diaper with me because it smells like baby powder and taking deep breath of it when was feeling anxious gave me an overwhelming feeling of excitement to see my baby make sure you talk to your ob keep her in the loop on how you feel my ob and all off the hospital staff was absolutely amazing the whole way through had ptsd with the second pregnancy and my ob did great job working me through it and the staff was so reassuring as got ready for my scheduled section even though really wished for some xanax and the second one was such night and day different you can do this felt like came out the other side stronger person as well you can do it and you won regret second of it once you are holding your little one hope this helped and didn freak you out more if you want to chat more am happy to try my best to help in addition to seeking treatment you should definitely look into getting yourself doula it is their job to focus on you and advocate for your wishes they are fantastic source of emotional support through the entire process was thinking therapy and hypnosis too op if when you choose to get pregnant highly recommend hypnobabies for childbirth preparation it really empowering and think would be nice complement to whatever therapy you get before hand the mindful birthing book and or class is also great option childbirth educator and doula fear and anxiety are really normal but if it at level that is causing you distress and preventing you from doing what you want then professional help is really good idea hugs you can do this totally second this read her books and it completely changed me and had successful vacation at home you might want to check out emdr as well as perhaps getting doula labor coach in your side or choosing midwife to attend or assist chose midwife in hospital setting to sttend my labor she did make it in until had been in the hospital couple of hours the regular nurses were doing their thing repeatedly trying to jab an iv line into my hand just in case needed it later did realize could say no the midwife fluttered in and immediately took charge oh dear how about we stop stabbing her we ll do the line if she needs it and let get the blood pressure continuous monitor off ll be sure to check it regularly now deary do you want to wear your pjs instead of that gown and go for walk with me yes yes do there are providers out there who will focus on you of course doctors are amazing and necessary in complicated or risky scenarios but even if you go that way you can have midwife to advocate for you hope it helpful read stories on birth without fear which might be good resource for you there are pictures etc so it helped me get more comfortable with my fear of the unknown wishing you the best would probably have to recommend trying to utilising variety of strategies to help you with these feelings that you are having counselling psychiatrist prozac cbt meditation even talking with an obgyn about what birth options you have whatever floats your boat childbirth is massive event in someone life so it good to have deep think about what is right for you you might even decide that it best for you and your baby to go under general anaesthetic for your birth whatever you choose there is nothing wrong with it don feel like your chickening out it about being pragmatic had long labour failure to progress which resulted in an emergency section often wonder how much my failure to progress was due to nerves seriously regret not electing for section earlier which personally would have felt alot more comfortable with but for some weird reason felt this immense societal pressure to have natural birth in hindsight it just doesn matter that had section all care about now is my big beautiful bubba best of luck as far as counselling will get you think you re going to have to be very selective of your birthing team it unfortunate that the state of obstetrics particularly in north america is very paternalistic it very common for doctors not to get consent for certain procedures like the ones you mentioned or to be generally rough with labouring mothers know women who had no fears going into labor that ended up with ppd after traumatic births not trying to scare you but it going to be worth knowing the doctors attending your birth will support your decision 100 invest in good doula to advocate for you and support you wish you luck if you go this route lt awesome they instigate life threatening situations and fix it found one the anesthesiologist who did my emergency section under general anaesthetic was amazing but he was also firm and upfront
